text: The very best relationship has a gardener and a flower.
author: Carole Radziwill

text: There are always flowers for those who want to see them.
author: Henri Matisse

text: The Japanese say, if the flower is to be beautiful, it must be cultivated.
author: Lester Cole

text: Every flower blooms in its own time.
author: Ken Petti

text: Open the bloom of your heart and become a gift of beauty to the world.
author: Bryant McGill

text: If love is sweet as a flower, then my mother is that sweet flower of love.
author: Stevie Wonder

text: A flower cannot blossom without sunshine, and man cannot live without love.
author: Max Muller

text: Flowers seem intended for the solace of ordinary humanity.
author: John Ruskin

text: In the spring, at the end of the day, you should smell like dirt.
author: Margaret Atwood

text: One of the most attractive things about flowers is their beautiful reserve.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Flowers always make people better, happier, and more helpful.
author: Luther Burbank

text: Weeds are flowers too, once you get to know them
author: A.A. Milne

text: Earth laughs in flowers.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Flowers don’t tell, they show.
author: Stephanie Skeem

text: Rough winds do shake the darling buds of May.
author: William Shakespeare

text: May our heart’s garden of awakening bloom with hundreds of flowers.
author: Nhat Hanh

text: Sweet April showers do spring May flowers.
author: Thomas Tusser

text: Flowers are a proud assertion that a ray of beauty outvalues all the utilities in the world.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: I must have flowers, always and always.
author: Claude Monet

text: Flowers don’t worry about how they’re going to bloom.
author: Jim Carrey

text: If we could see the miracle of a single flower clearly our whole life would change.
author: Buddha

text: To plant a garden is to believe in tomorrow.
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: Don’t let the tall weeds cast a shadow on the beautiful flowers in your garden.
author: Steve Maraboli

text: Happiness held is the seed; Happiness shared is the flower.
author: John Harrigan

text: She sprouted love like flowers, grew a garden in her mind.
author: Erin Hanson

text: Spring comes: the flowers learn their colored shapes
author: Maria Konopnicka

text: Blossom by blossom the spring begins.
author: Algernon Charles Swinburne

text: Flowers whisper ‘Beauty!’ to the world, even as they fade, wilt, fall.
author: Dr. SunWolf

text: Don’t hurry, don’t worry. And be sure to smell the flowers along the way.
author: Walter Hagen

text: Even the tiniest of flowers can have the toughest roots.
author: Shannon Mullen

text: Every flower blooms at its own pace.
author: Suzy Kassem

text: Flowers grow out of dark moments.
author: Corita Kent

text: The flower fades that is not looked upon.
author: Edward Counsel

text: If you take a flower in your hand and really look at it, it’s your world for a moment.
author: Georgia O’Keefe.

text: Gardens and flowers have a way of bringing people together, drawing them from their homes.
author: Clare Ansberry

text: We’re all golden sunflowers inside.
author: Allen Ginsberg

text: The sunflower is a favorite emblem of constancy.
author: Thomas Bulfinch

text: The sunflower is mine, in a way.
author: Vincent Van Gogh

text: Never look directly at the sun, instead look at the sunflower.
author: Vera Nazarian

text: The road to freedom is bordered with sunflowers.
author: Martin Firrell

text: Sunflowers are like people to me.
author: Joan Mitchell

text: The sunflower is mine, in a way.
author: Vincent Van Gogh

text: Let a hundred flowers bloom.
author: Mao Zedong

text: Let us dance in the sun, wearing wildflowers in our hair.
author: Susan Polis Schutz

text: Smile to the world and smile to the people you love, as a sunflower smiles at the sun.
author: Remez Sasson

text: A sunflower teaches us so much about love.
author: Samrah Ahmad

text: You look beautiful as a sunflower and charming as a rose.
author: Avijeet Das

text: I chose a sunflower because when darkness descends they close up to regenerate.
author: Halle Berry

text: Restless sunflower; cease to move.
author: Pedro Calderon de la Barca

text: I plant sunflowers and get back daily joy.
author: Nadine Locke

text: Be like a flower and turn your face to the sun.”
author: Kahlil Gibran
